message.content:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: public class Test {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        String[] testStrings = {"45", "45.00", "45.0", "45.000", "45.23"};

        for (String s : testStrings) {
            StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(s, ".");
            String integerPart = st.nextToken();
            String decimalPart = st.hasMoreTokens() ? st.nextToken() : null;

            if (decimalPart != null && !decimalPart.matches("0+")) {
                System.out.println(integerPart + "." + decimalPart);
            } else {
                System.out.println(integerPart);
            }
        }
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: This code uses the StringTokenizer to split the string into two parts: the integer part and the decimal part. If the decimal part is not null and does not consist of only zeros, it prints the original string. Otherwise, it only prints the integer part.
